content.rendered:
In the fairly recent past there have been a number of staff changes at the DfE. As a result policy is now centred on Computing Science and the e-safety aspect of Digital Literacy. Understanding of the importance of much of the other two strands has been sidelined: Information Technology and Digital Literacy.

As professionals we are now working to raise the profile of the other strands and to secure funding to promote them to schools by collating resources, undertaking research and training the trainers. Damian Hinds has announced a budget of £10m that we intend to pursue.

In the interim we have written article and reports that we can repurpose to develop a definitive submission about our proposals. These reports have all mentioned the support of our associates. We hope that you will join us in this campaign. Please join the online report writing ginger group by emailing Christina@mirandanet.ac.uk

We will be focusing our submission on the policies outlined by Damian Hinds at BETT19 but we hope to extend this remit which is very limited in scope.

Here are the different reports mentioning our associates that can be mined to reflect what our members are thinking….

  • Article for TES
  • Article for CCoT edtech journal
  • Knowledge Exchange submission to DfE
  • SCITT proposal – the idea was dropped by the DfE
  • Improving Recruitment and Retention using technology to DFE
  • IRIS Connect on using the efficiencies of technology to improve outcomes and reduce costs

(These final two documents are drafts to be developed.)

  • The text from the BETT19 meeting that meets the 3 DfE questions about the value of technology that we are tackling again in our conference
  • Damian Hinds at BETT19
